image.altText: Sebastian Johnston is grinning

props.synopsis: After waking from a week-long induced coma, Sebastian Johnston was diagnosed with epilepsy and an acquired brain injury. Now he is calling for more understanding for young people living with the condition.

title.children: People living with epilepsy can 'slip through the cracks', advocates say

image.altText: Two teenage boys stand wearing red sports uniforms at dusk.

props.synopsis: Junior players of a traditional Indian sport are allowed to compete at the Australian Sikh Games for the first time in the event's 37-year history.

title.children: Youngsters to compete in ancient sport for first time at Sikh games

image.altText: Matthew Draganoff in front of a Union Jack flag

props.synopsis: Matthew Draganoff is standing trial accused of the shooting murder of his tenant, Simon Middleton. Prosecutors allege there had been an "accumulation of grievances" that led to the crime.

title.children: Man allegedly murdered tenant over 'growing animosity', jury told

image.altText: A farmer stands on a piece of rusted machinery in the middle of a farm

props.synopsis: Despite applying for government drought funding months ago, one South Australian farmer says he is still waiting for assistance.

title.children: Farmer waits on drought relief payments for months

image.altText: Willie Rioli carries two football bags at training

props.synopsis: Port coach Ken Hinkley labels racist abuse directed towards Willie Rioli as "a disgrace", as the Power forward returns to training after being granted a day off.

title.children: Rioli returns to Port as coach labels racist attacks an 'absolute disgrace'

image.altText: A QantasLink plane on the tarmac

props.synopsis: Passengers out of SA's biggest regional city could soon see a spike in flight prices as more airports are forced to bring in security screening.

title.children: Mount Gambier airport passengers face 'unsustainable' $90 fare hike

image.altText: Stella  hugs her daughter as they walk along the footpath outside the District Court

props.synopsis: A woman who was abused at the hands of her ex-partner – a former police detective – says she felt "silenced" after reaching out to SA Police, a court has heard. Their daughter also recounted his abuse and said she no longer considered him her father.

title.children: 'I will not be silenced': Woman confronts abusive ex-cop husband in court

image.altText: People wait to board a train pulling into a station.

props.synopsis: Adelaide public transport users continue to pay maximum fares for short trips three years after Labor returned to government, despite its former treasury spokesperson labelling it a "blatant cash-grab" when the Liberal party axed it in 2019.

title.children: No return to two-section fares in Adelaide despite 'cash grab' claims

image.altText: A flood approaches a small outback town surrounded by a levy

props.synopsis: Emergency services say road closures around the remote South Australian town of Innamincka are likely to be in place for months, prompting concern about the local tourism industry.

title.children: As floodwaters recede, Innamincka locals face long wait for roads to re-open

image.altText: Aerial view into a car showing a driver resting a mobile phone on their lap

props.synopsis: Police have issued more than 46,000 fines in six months to Adelaide drivers caught using mobile phones and are "disappointed" at the number of repeat offenders – including one driver detected 41 times.

title.children: Driver caught on mobile phone detection cameras 41 times

image.altText: A man in a check shirt leans on a gate

props.synopsis: South Australian independent MP Nick McBride is facing multiple counts of assaulting a person known to him, after he was arrested and charged last week.

title.children: South Australian MP Nick McBride arrested and charged with assault

image.altText: Cyclist Melissa Hoskins smiles during an interview.

props.synopsis: The mother of former Olympic cyclist Melissa Hoskins has told an Adelaide court she accepts her daughter's death was a "tragic accident".

title.children: Mother of Melissa Hoskins says Olympian's death was a 'tragic accident'

image.altText: Brooke Kerton and her partner Jesse

props.synopsis: Advocates admit co-operative housing models are not for everyone but say for the right residents, they offer more security and affordable pricing than traditional rentals.

title.children: Shared living model offers hope amid rental housing crunch

image.altText: Tradies work on the roof frame of a new home under construction.

props.synopsis: The Coalition says it wants to "rebalance" the school system to better promote trades and apprenticeships.

title.children: Dutton pledges to bring back Howard-era technical schools

image.altText: A man stood on rocks on the edge of the ocean

props.synopsis: Australia's weather will be firing on all cylinders this Easter long weekend, with a cyclone in the north, powerful swell in the east and a swing from hot to cool in the south.

title.children: Easter weather brings a cyclone, swells and temperature whiplash

image.altText: A large pile of rubbish on a street.

props.synopsis: Birmingham residents haven't had their rubbish collected in six weeks, as a pay dispute between bin workers and the council leads to trash piling up in public spaces and rodents running rampant.

title.children: No end in sight for UK city's 'disgusting' rat and rubbish nightmare

image.altText: A blurred image of a teen being arrested

props.synopsis: Police allege the teenager used an encrypted application to facilitate plans for overseas contract killings. He was formally refused bail in Surry Hills Children's Court and is scheduled to reappear on June 11.

title.children: Boy, 15, charged in Sydney with organising contract killings online

image.altText: A stylised graphic showing two young people, the TikTok logo and two charts

props.synopsis: A new tool created by researchers at the Queensland University of Technology is allowing people to see themselves through the eyes of the algorithm.

title.children: Peering inside his TikTok viewing history, one user finds it is 'not just raw, pointless data'

image.altText: A 17-year-old with large headphones resting on his shoulders poses for a portrait in front of his gaming PC.

props.synopsis: Popular video games are utilising harmful tactics to trap kids into spending more cash and more time gaming, a new consumer report finds.

title.children: Kids trapped for hours by deceptive video game features, report finds

image.altText: A foreign airline passenger is greeted by a Customs and Border Protection Officer at an immigration desk.

props.synopsis: Immigration lawyers provide advice on US travel, as border security officials conduct 'enhanced vetting' of travellers with broad powers to refuse any visa holder entry.

title.children: Travelling to the US? Immigration lawyers suggest using a burner phone

image.altText: Two men in prison suits are knelt on the floor as guards shave their heads.

props.synopsis: Officials in Donald Trump's administration could face criminal prosecution, a US judge says, because they have shown "wilful disregard" for a bar on deporting alleged gang members to El Salvador.

title.children: Trump officials wilfully defied court order on deportations, judge finds

image.altText: A cyclone map

props.synopsis: The severe tropical cyclone has strengthened to a category four system as it continues to track towards WA's Kimberley coast.

title.children: Warning for travellers, residents as Cyclone Errol intensifies to category four

image.altText: Lady Gaga stands outstretched with a white cape flowing. She wears some armour mixed in with a white linen outfit.

props.synopsis: Fans are reeling over ticket prices for the superstar’s upcoming Australian tour, her first in 11 years.

title.children: Fans shocked by expensive Lady Gaga tickets, but is it dynamic pricing?

image.altText: A woman standing in a half finished room with doors yet to be installed behind her.

props.synopsis: Homeowners who say their complaints to the Victorian Building Authority failed to materially improve their situation, are now calling on the state government to provide compensation.

title.children: 'It rules your life': Owners of unfinished homes in limbo in Victoria

image.altText: Two men sit in different yellow-coloured armchairs looking at each other smirking in an ornate room

props.synopsis: Analysts say countries around the world will be watching the outcome of the meeting closely to determine how best to negotiate on the issue of US tariffs.

title.children: US and Japan aim for deal on tariffs as Donald Trump joins talks

image.altText: 2025-04-11T132657Z_952076589_RC2PVDAU6Q9K_RTRMADP_3_RUSSIA-PUTIN

props.synopsis: Russia defends its military cooperation with Jakarta in its first direct response to claims that it sought access to an Indonesian air base.

title.children: Russia responds to claims it sought access to Indonesian air base

image.altText: Women's rights activists hold placards that say women are born

props.synopsis: The court upheld an appeal by a campaign group on whether transgender women are legally women under equality legislation.

title.children: UK court rules a woman is defined by the gender at birth

image.altText: A young white man with brown hair, wearing khaki clothing and dog tags, crouches in the jungle

props.synopsis: The Hollywood star plays a POW in the much-anticipated screen adaptation of Richard Flanagan's Booker-Prize-winning novel, Narrow Road to the Deep North.

title.children: Why a Hollywood heart-throb wanted to star in Narrow Road to the Deep North

image.altText: Donald Trump with his hand in the air as he disembarks a plane

props.synopsis: A Lowy Institute poll has found voters are almost evenly split on whether Peter Dutton or Anthony Albanese would be better placed to manage Australia's relationship with Donald Trump, but back the Labor leader when it comes to Xi Jinping.

title.children: Australians' trust in the US falls to two-decade low since Trump re-election

image.altText: Kids in Bluey pjs examine a flooded road, road signs in the background

props.synopsis: The warning from researchers comes after Cyclone Alfred resulted in the cancellation of more than 3,500 blood donation appointments in Queensland and NSW.

title.children: Increase in extreme weather events posing 'substantial risk' to blood supplies

image.altText: A boat crashes against rocks in a wild sea.

props.synopsis: Locals say more deaths are "inevitable" at Narooma Bar if steps to improve safety are not taken, but opinions on how to address the issue vary.

title.children: Calls for safety to be improved at Australia's deadliest coastal entrance

image.altText: A man is giving a speech, pointing up with one finger

props.synopsis: Former US President Joe Biden has criticised  President Donald Trump for taking "a hatchet" to the popular social security government agency that provides benefits to more than 70 million Americans.

title.children: Biden slams Trump in first speech since leaving White House

image.altText: Two stars with their orbits depicted in linked rings, with a planet shown orbiting the stars in a perpendicular ring.

props.synopsis: It's not the first time researchers have found a planet like the one in Star Wars, but this alien world has a particularly peculiar polar orbit around its two suns.

title.children: Star Wars' Tatooine-like planet baffles astronomers with its strange orbit

image.altText: A man in a black shirt sits on a couch with his right arm around a woman in a white shirt.

props.synopsis: Leah Pitman and Dustin Atkinson say failings at Northern Beaches Hospital caused the death of their newborn baby Harper. This is their harrowing and heartbreaking story.

title.children: Leah was 'heartbroken' by a toddler's death. A day later she suffered a similar tragedy

image.altText: Four men stand behind a table as three men cut a large brown chocolate cake standing in front of an ATM

props.synopsis: Residents on the Pacific island of Tuvalu have previously withdrawn cash from banks on payday, with long queues ensuing at bank branches.

title.children: Pacific island nation gains access to electronic banking for first time ever
